sections.title: Introduction
sections.content:
PURPOSE OF THE DOCPROPERTY TITLE \* MERGEFORMAT TEST CASE DOCUMENT
[Provide the purpose of the DOCPROPERTY Title \* MERGEFORMAT Test Case Document. This document should be tailored to fit a particular projectâ€™s needs.]
The DOCPROPERTY Title \* MERGEFORMAT Test Case document documents the functional requirements of the test case. The intended audience is the project manager, project team, and testing team. Some portions of this document may on occasion be shared with the client/user and other stakeholder whose input/approval into the testing process is needed.

sections.title: Test Case Specification
sections.content: [Describe the test case to be performed]

subsections.title: Description
subsections.content: [Describe the test case and the individuals involved in the testing. Include diagrams depicting the interaction between individuals and the different elements being tested.]

subsections.title: Resources
subsections.content: [Describe the individuals involved in the testing, their responsibilities, and their association with the test case.]

subsections.title: Preconditions
subsections.content: [Describe the preconditions for the test case. A precondition is the state of the system that must exist before a test case can be performed.]

subsections.title: Post Conditions
subsections.content: [Describe the post conditions for the use case. A post condition is a list of possible states the system can be in immediately after a test case has finished.]

subsections.title: Flow of Events
subsections.content: [Describe the flow of events that would be expected in normal conditions as well as any potential alternate flow of events, and exceptions/errors that may be expected.]

subsections.title: Inclusion/Exclusion Points
subsections.content: [Describe other test cases that may be included or excluded in the act of executing this test case.]

subsections.title: Special Requirements
subsections.content: [Describe any special requirements necessary to perform the test case.]
